requirement_tested: Frontend application with data visualization components for basketball analytics
user_persona: A basketball analyst who wants to visualize player performance trends.
user_goal: To interact with a data visualization chart to analyze player efficiency over time.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Alex navigates to the basketball analytics dashboard where several chart placeholders are visible.
narrative_steps.action: Page loads and makes API calls to fetch data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Charts display 'Loading...' initially, then populate with interactive visualizations after data is fetched.

narrative_steps.title: Expanding Chart View
narrative_steps.description: Alex sees a line chart showing player efficiency and decides to expand it for better visibility.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Chart expands to full-view mode within the grid layout.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Data Points
narrative_steps.description: While examining the expanded chart, Alex hovers over specific data points to see detailed values.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over data points on the chart.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tooltip appears displaying detailed statistical values such as player efficiency rating.

requirement_tested: Backend API service that connects to PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer deploying the application for the first time.
user_goal: To verify that the backend successfully connects to the PostgreSQL database on startup.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Jordan starts the backend service expecting it to initialize the database connection.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Backend connects to PostgreSQL using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Schema Creation
narrative_steps.description: Jordan checks whether the necessary tables were created if they didn't already exist.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tables 'matches', 'teams', and 'players' are present in the database with correct schemas.

requirement_tested: Data fetching from backend APIs for all dynamic content with no hardcoded data
user_persona: A new visitor exploring the website for the first time.
user_goal: To view up-to-date basketball analytics without seeing any placeholder or mock data.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Taylor visits the homepage and expects to see real-time basketball data immediately.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All dynamic sections show loading spinners briefly before rendering actual data retrieved via API calls.

narrative_steps.title: Handling Network Failure
narrative_steps.description: During peak traffic, Taylor experiences network issues causing API failures.
narrative_steps.action: Simulate slow or failed API response.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Error messages appear instead of blank spaces indicating data could not be loaded.

user_persona: A fan wanting to look up past game results between two favorite teams.
user_goal: To find and sort historical match records involving their favorite teams.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Match History Page
narrative_steps.description: Casey clicks on the 'Match History' link in the main navigation menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Paginated table of past matches loads with columns: Date, Teams, Final Score, Result, sorted descending by date.

narrative_steps.title: Sorting Matches by Date
narrative_steps.description: Casey wants to see the oldest games first and clicks the date column header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Table re-sorts ascending by date.

narrative_steps.title: Loading More Matches
narrative_steps.description: After scrolling down, Casey reaches the end of the current list and waits for more matches.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the match list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional pages of match history load automatically.

requirement_tested: Team rankings display with up-to-date statistics
user_persona: A fantasy basketball manager checking league standings.
user_goal: To quickly identify top-performing teams and navigate to a team's detailed stats page.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Team Rankings
narrative_steps.description: Riley goes to the 'Team Rankings' section to assess how teams are performing this season.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Teams are displayed in ranked order with logos, names, win-loss records, and ranking positions.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Top Team
narrative_steps.description: Riley notices the leading team and clicks its card to explore deeper insights.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the top-ranked team card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to the selected teamâ€™s dedicated stats profile page.

user_persona: A scout evaluating potential draft picks.
user_goal: To review individual player stats and access detailed profiles.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Player Stats
narrative_steps.description: Morgan accesses the player performance section to compare key metrics among prospects.
narrative_steps.action: Go to the player stats page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Sortable roster lists per team are shown with headshots, names, jersey numbers, and average stats in slate gray rows.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Detailed Profile
narrative_steps.description: Morgan finds an interesting player and clicks their row to view career stats and advanced metrics.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to the player's full-profile page with career timeline and metric breakdowns.

narrative_steps.title: Previewing Season Trend
narrative_steps.description: Before making a decision, Morgan hovers over the player row to preview seasonal progress.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Season progression trendline appears beneath basic stats.

requirement_tested: Match prediction algorithm with results display
user_persona: A casual bettor interested in informed predictions.
user_goal: To get a prediction for an upcoming match and understand the reasoning behind it.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Match Prediction
narrative_steps.description: Jamie looks at a match detail page and sees a prediction summary generated by the system.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Prediction panel displays predicted winner, margin of victory, and confidence level icon.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Prediction Logic
narrative_steps.description: Curious about how the prediction was made, Jamie taps the 'View Details' button.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'View Details' next to the prediction.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Modal opens showing underlying data inputs like recent form and injury reports.

requirement_tested: Betting recommendation engine based on analytical data
user_persona: An experienced gambler seeking high-value bets.
user_goal: To discover and act on betting opportunities derived from analytical models.

narrative_steps.title: Discovering Betting Recommendations
narrative_steps.description: Pat browses the betting recommendations feed to find promising wagers.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the Predictions tab and locate the Betting Recommendations module.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Feed shows entries with recommended bet type, stake percentage, EV ratio, and linked match previews.

narrative_steps.title: Placing a Recommended Bet
narrative_steps.description: Seeing a favorable pick, Pat decides to place the bet through a trusted sportsbook.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Place Bet' on a recommendation entry.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Modal prompts selection of bookmaker and redirects externally to complete the wager securely.

requirement_tested: User interface with ghost white background and slate gray components
user_persona: A designer reviewing UI consistency across devices.
user_goal: To ensure the site maintains its intended color scheme throughout all views.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Homepage Theme
narrative_steps.description: Dana inspects the homepage layout to confirm theme adherence.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Entire background is ghost white; navigation bars, buttons, and panels are styled in slate gray.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Subpages Consistency
narrative_steps.description: Dana navigates to various subpages to verify consistent theming.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All pages maintain the same ghost white background and slate gray component styling.

requirement_tested: Interactive charts and graphs for sports data visualization
user_persona: A researcher analyzing basketball trends over seasons.
user_goal: To manipulate and explore complex datasets using interactive chart features.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting With Axes
narrative_steps.description: Quinn drags an axis label to change what variable is plotted on the x-axis.
narrative_steps.action: Drag and drop an axis label.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Chart updates dynamically to reflect the new axis assignment.

narrative_steps.title: Zooming Into Data
narrative_steps.description: While inspecting clustered data, Quinn uses the scroll wheel to zoom in.
narrative_steps.action: Use mouse wheel over chart region.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Chart zooms into the selected area for detailed inspection.

narrative_steps.title: Resetting Selection
narrative_steps.description: After exploring, Quinn double-clicks to reset the chart view.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Chart returns to default scale and deselected state.

requirement_tested: Database schema for storing basketball match data, team info, and player statistics
user_persona: A database administrator setting up the system.
user_goal: To validate that the correct schema has been applied to the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Table Structures
narrative_steps.description: Sam connects to the PostgreSQL instance to verify the presence and structure of core tables.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tables 'matches', 'teams', and 'players' exist with defined columns matching the schema.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Index Definitions
narrative_steps.description: Sam ensures indexes are properly defined for optimized queries.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Indexes exist on matches.date, teams.name, and players.team_id for fast lookups.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for retrieving match history, rankings, and player data
user_persona: A frontend developer integrating backend data.
user_goal: To consume RESTful endpoints and render accurate data in the UI.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Match History
narrative_steps.description: Devon makes a GET request to retrieve match history data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns JSON payload with match logs ordered by date.

narrative_steps.title: Retrieving Team Rankings
narrative_steps.description: Devon integrates team rankings into the standings page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Receives JSON containing team leaderboard standings and stats.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Player Statistics
narrative_steps.description: Devon populates the player stats table with backend data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Gets JSON with comprehensive player performance summaries.

requirement_tested: Real-time or scheduled data update mechanism for current basketball information
user_persona: An operations engineer monitoring data freshness.
user_goal: To ensure the system keeps internal data synchronized with external sources.

narrative_steps.title: Triggering Scheduled Sync
narrative_steps.description: Omar checks if the scheduled sync process ran as expected overnight.
narrative_steps.action: Review sync logs or simulate cron trigger.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Fresh data from external APIs ingested and updated in PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Sync Logs
narrative_steps.description: Omar reviews logs to catch any errors during synchronization.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Logs indicate successful sync attempts with timestamps and statuses.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with install:all script for frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: A new contributor joining the project.
user_goal: To set up the development environment quickly with one command.

narrative_steps.title: Running Install Script
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clones the repo and runs the unified install command.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` from root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed concurrently without errors.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with dev script to run frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: A developer starting daily work on the project.
user_goal: To launch both frontend and backend servers simultaneously for efficient development.

narrative_steps.title: Launching Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Jordan begins working by running the dev script to start both environments.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run dev` from the root folder.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend dev server and backend API listener start concurrently in a shared terminal session.
